text: The 2015–16 Czech Extraliga season is the 23rd season of the Czech Extraliga since its creation after the breakup of Czechoslovakia and the Czechoslovak First Ice Hockey League in 1993. If two or more skaters are tied (i.e. same number of points, goals and played games), all of the tied skaters are shown. HC Bílí Tygři Liberec has won its first ever league title. ==Relegation== {|cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" border="1" style="font-size: 95%; text-align: center; border: gray solid 1px; border- collapse: collapse;" width="50%" |- bgcolor=#efefef ! width="20" |Place || width="185" | Team || width="20" | GP || width="20" | W || width="20" | OTW || width="20" | OTL || width="20" | L || width="20" | GF|| width="20" | GA || width="20" | Pts |- align=center bgcolor=ccffcc |1 ||HC Vítkovice Steel || 58|| 19|| 6|| 5 || 28 || 155 || 161||74 |- align=center bgcolor=ccffcc |2 ||HC Dynamo Pardubice || 58 || 19|| 4|| 5|| 30|| 129|| 170|| 70 |- align=center bgcolor=ffcccc |3 ||HC Verva Litvínov ||58|| 13|| 12 || 6|| 27|| 130|| 149|| 69 |- align=center bgcolor=ffcccc |4 ||HC Energie Karlovy Vary || 58|| 13|| 3|| 3|| 39|| 122 || 200|| 48 |} == References == == External links == * Czech Category:2015–16 in Czech ice hockey leagues Category:Czech Extraliga seasons
